'Macedonia' is a geographical and historical region of the Balkan peninsula in
southeastern Europe. Its boundaries have changed considerably over time, but
nowadays the region is considered to include parts of five Balkan countries:
Greece, the Republic of Macedonia, Bulgaria, Albania, Serbia (including the Gora
region in Kosovo). It covers approximately and has a population of 4.76 million.

Its oldest known settlements date back approximately 9,000 years. From the
middle of the 4th century BC, the Kingdom of Macedon became the dominant
power in Greece and the neighbouring regions; since then Macedonia has had a
diverse history.
